general_advisory: Due to low night temperature and fog condition, there will be a chance of infestation of sucking pests, leaf blight, and powdery mildew in the Rabi crops and vegetables. Monitor the crops and vegetables, undertake appropriate plant protection measures. Carry out weeding, hoeing, and other intercultural operations in Rabi vegetables. In Cole crops, irrigation should be done at 7-8 days interval depending upon soil moisture and weather conditions.

advisory: Arrange good quality paddy seed varieties like Satyabhama, Sahabhagi Dhan, Mandakini, Manaswini, DRR 42, DRR-43, DRR-44, Bina 11, GB-1, Improved Lalat, MTU 1010, MTU 1001, Naveen, Swarna Shreya which can be grown during the dry season.
Seed rate for an acre of land is 20 kg for these varieties.
Treat the seeds with Carbendazim 50% W.P @ 2-gram/1-kg of seeds or Carboxin 37.5% + Thiram 37.5 % @ 3-gram /1 kg of seeds before sowing in the nursery.
Apply half dose of Urea + half dose of MOP as 2nd top dressing at second irrigation.

Prevailing weather conditions favor the development of sucking pests. Need-based spray of Acetamiprid 20% SP @ 50g/acre or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 60 ml/acre mixed with 200 ltrs of water is recommended.
Spray 0.2% wettable sulphur @ 2g /ltr of water for powdery mildew.
Select YMV disease-resistant varieties like PDM 139, PDM 11.
To prevent whitefly infestation, seeds should be treated with Imidacloprid @ 7-gram/kg of seeds before sowing.
Install 8-10 nos of yellow sticky traps starting from 2-3 leaf stage of the crop.
Similar to blackgram advisory.
There are chances of Aphid infestation in early-sown mustard crop. To manage aphids at the early stage, put 8 numbers of yellow sticky traps per acre.
Spray Neem-based pesticide 1500 PPM @ 600-ml/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water.

To manage whitefly in Brinjal and Tomato crop, use yellow sticky traps @ 8-10/acre to attract and kill the insects.
To control a fruit borer in Tomato, first collect and destroy the affected fruits and grown-up larvae.
Set up 20 nos. of a pheromone trap having Helilure per acre.
To prevent Damping off disease in nursery, drench the nursery bed with Carbendazim @ 2 g/litre of water at 15 days interval.

Provide proper shelter to the animals with proper ventilation facilities.
Floor should be clean, dry, and bedding with straw which act as insulation and prevention of heat loss.

Feed should be available to the bird the whole day.

Farmers are advised to apply Cifax @ 400 ml mixed with 40 litres of water in one acre pond area as a preventive measure.
